intro: Sisymbrium pimpinellifolium, commonly known as wild mustard, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant is also cultivated for its seeds, which are used in cooking and as a source of oil.
